name: Easyjet Experience from Luton to Turin
description:
Fancy being a Patron? https://www.patreon.com/paulstripreports

Date of Travel: 04 FEB 2017
Aircraft: Airbus A319
Tail: G-EZAA
Livery: Old Easyjet livery
Route: LTN-TRN
Weather on Departure: Cloudy, winds 15kts
Weather on Arrival: Broken cloud, winds calm
Airborne Time: 1h41m
Miles: 588
Remarks: None


Thanks for finding my video and pressing play! 

Join me as I take an Easyjet A319 between London Luton Airport and Turin!

This very cheap flight was good value, despite a few hiccups. Luton Airport is currently undergoing massive redevelopment at the moment, so the place looks like a building site…and feels like one too!

No lounge on this visit (I’m not buying a PriorityPass until May), but this was a straightforward trip – it would have helped if they’d opened the aircraft rear doos having been told to board up the rear steps though!

Enjoy the great Alpine scenery on approach to Turin, as well as a fabulously clear flypast of London Heathrow at 20,000 feet!


MY MOST-WATCHED VIDEO - BRITISH AIRWAYS FIRST CLASS 787 REPORT: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4LRFyTtxlRg
